column5: Well today was the day to finally take my son out in the canoe for a short fishin' trip. He's just past 2 and a half now and I figured I was ready.  We launched from Centennial Beach on Kempenfelt Bay because of the easy beach area for the little guy.    After it was established that he wasn't going to try to jump out, or throw a fit, I set about trying to coax a panfish or to from the depths.    There was some concern he would drop my ultrlite combo into the abyss.    And despite expert advise on not reeling the fish right up to the tip-top he was no match for the expert.    No worries about holding on the the fish.      Although he was more interested in playing with my spare paddle in the water.       Great day.
Nice shots. Good outing for the young one. Who was taking the photos?
Well...the canoe doesn't look THAT short....but it definitely looked like a great day on the water
Great photos, looks like a nice day out there.  I'm guessing it is a GoPro camera on the canoe?
Great day on the water eh!  A good way to get the boy into fishing.   If you would have gone out yesterday, you would have seen a military search and rescue helicopter flying around the bay.
My wife was in the front.
Get out with him as often as you can. Just one word of warning. Them eyes spell mischief
Heart warming site KF !!! That little guy show spink.  Thanks  Paul
Family reports are the best part of OFC! thanks!
Good looking young lad you have there Rob nice report!!!  The only thing missing is his little Habs jersey!!!
Awesome KF....dont think my boy would sit still enough to get in a canoe...good job!
That just warms the cockels of my heart! And yes, those eyes say All Boy! Have fun as he gets older.
Rob,thats FANTASTIC  Can you work on yer swirl back ground.    Awesome bud.
